docs.title: AutoPS Beta 0.5
docs.text: AutoPS is a powerful PowerShell automation framework for orchestrating tasks, workflows, and jobs with multi-language runtime support.

docs.title: ✨ Features
docs.text: Feature Description 🚀 Task Automation Define reusable PowerShell tasks with retry logic 🔄 Workflow Orchestration Chain tasks with dependency management 📅 Job Scheduling Run jobs manually or on cron schedules 🔁 Retry Logic Configurable retries with delays 📊 Execution Tracking Query and monitor all executions 📝 Structured Logging Filter logs by level, time, keywords 🌐 Multi-Runtime Support for Python, Node.js, and more

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Start
docs.text:
# Initialize and check system health
./autops.ps1 init

# Run a job
./autops.ps1 run hello_world

# Query recent executions
./autops.ps1 query -Top 10

# View error logs
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Error

docs.title: 📐 Architecture
docs.text: graph TD     A[CLI: autops.ps1] --> B[Manifest]     B --> C[Jobs]     B --> D[Workflows]     B --> E[Tasks]     C --> D     D --> E     E --> F[PowerShell/Python/Node Scripts]     A --> G[Database]     G --> H[Executions]     G --> I[Logs]

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
• Installation - Setup instructions
  • Quick Start - Your first job

docs.title: Core Concepts
docs.text:
• Tasks - Building blocks of automation
  • Workflows - Task orchestration
  • Jobs - Top-level execution units
  • Manifest - Configuration registry

docs.title: CLI Reference
docs.text:
• Commands - Complete command reference
  • Query - Execution history queries
  • Logs - Log filtering and search

docs.title: Integrations
docs.text:
• Overview - Available integrations
  • Filesystem - File operations
  • Git - Version control
  • HTTP - REST API calls

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• ETL Pipeline - Data processing workflow
  • Retry Logic - Handling failures

docs.title: 📋 Requirements
docs.text:
• PowerShell 5.1 or higher
  • Windows, macOS, or Linux

docs.title: 📄 License
docs.text: MIT License - See LICENSE file for details.

docs.title: CLI Commands Reference
docs.text: Complete reference for all AutoPS Beta 0.5 CLI commands with examples.

docs.title: Usage Syntax
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 <command> [options]

docs.title: Commands Overview
docs.text: Command Description init Initialize system and run health checks run Execute a job immediately query Query execution history logs View and filter log entries list List available automations submit Submit job for async execution service Run in daemon/service mode health (Deprecated) Use init instead

docs.title: init
docs.text: Initializes the system: validates manifest, database, integrations, runtimes, and builds documentation.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Full initialization with health checks
./autops.ps1 init

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
╔═══════════════════════════════════════╗
  ║        AutoPS Initialization          ║
  ╚═══════════════════════════════════════╝

  [✓] Manifest  (8 tasks, 1 workflows, 5 jobs)
  [✓] Database  (Json)

  Integrations:
  [✓] filesystem [CORE]
  [✓] git
  [✓] http

  Runtimes:
  [✓] python/mkdocs_3.13

  Documentation:
  [✓] Built to ./docs/site

  Initialization complete.

docs.title: run
docs.text: Executes a job immediately and displays output.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 run <job_name> [-Params @{...}]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Run a simple job
./autops.ps1 run hello_world

# Run with parameters
./autops.ps1 run data_pipeline -Params @{ env = "production" }

# Run with multiple parameters
./autops.ps1 run data_pipeline -Params @{ 
    env = "staging"
    debug = $true
    maxRetries = 5 
}

# Run ETL job
./autops.ps1 run etl_job

# Run notification job
./autops.ps1 run notify_job

# Run retry test job
./autops.ps1 run retry_job

docs.title: query
docs.text: Query and filter execution history.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 query [options]

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Values Default Description -Type job, workflow, task, all all Filter by type -Status Running, Completed, Failed, Waiting, All All Filter by status -ExecutionId GUID - Get specific execution tree -Name string - Filter by name -StartedAfter datetime - Filter by start time -StartedBefore datetime - Filter by start time -Top integer 10 Limit results -Sort StartedAt, EndedAt, Status, RuntimeMs StartedAt Sort field -SortOrder Asc, Desc Desc Sort direction

docs.title: Examples - Basic Queries
docs.text:
# List recent executions (default: top 10)
./autops.ps1 query

# List more results
./autops.ps1 query -Top 50

# List only jobs
./autops.ps1 query -Type job

# List only workflows
./autops.ps1 query -Type workflow

# List only tasks
./autops.ps1 query -Type task

docs.title: Examples - Status Filters
docs.text:
# All failed executions
./autops.ps1 query -Status Failed

# All running executions
./autops.ps1 query -Status Running

# All waiting executions
./autops.ps1 query -Status Waiting

# All completed executions
./autops.ps1 query -Status Completed

# Failed jobs only
./autops.ps1 query -Type job -Status Failed

# Running tasks only
./autops.ps1 query -Type task -Status Running

docs.title: Examples - Time Filters
docs.text:
# Executions after specific time
./autops.ps1 query -StartedAfter "2026-01-16 10:00:00"

# Executions before specific time
./autops.ps1 query -StartedBefore "2026-01-16 18:00:00"

# Executions in time range
./autops.ps1 query -StartedAfter "2026-01-16 09:00:00" -StartedBefore "2026-01-16 17:00:00"

# Today's failures
./autops.ps1 query -Status Failed -StartedAfter (Get-Date).Date

docs.title: Examples - Sorting
docs.text:
# Sort by runtime (slowest first)
./autops.ps1 query -Sort RuntimeMs -SortOrder Desc

# Sort by runtime (fastest first)
./autops.ps1 query -Sort RuntimeMs -SortOrder Asc

# Sort by end time
./autops.ps1 query -Sort EndedAt -SortOrder Desc

# Sort by status
./autops.ps1 query -Sort Status

# Oldest executions first
./autops.ps1 query -SortOrder Asc

docs.title: Examples - Execution Tree
docs.text:
# Get full execution tree by ID (shows job + workflows + tasks)
./autops.ps1 query -ExecutionId "abc12345-def6-7890-abcd-ef1234567890"

docs.title: Examples - Combined Filters
docs.text:
# Failed jobs in last hour, sorted by runtime
./autops.ps1 query -Type job -Status Failed -StartedAfter ((Get-Date).AddHours(-1)) -Sort RuntimeMs

# Top 5 slowest completed tasks
./autops.ps1 query -Type task -Status Completed -Sort RuntimeMs -SortOrder Desc -Top 5

# All workflow executions today
./autops.ps1 query -Type workflow -StartedAfter (Get-Date).Date -Top 100

docs.title: logs
docs.text: View and filter log entries.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 logs [options]

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Values Default Description -Level Info, Warn, Error, Debug, All All Filter by severity -After datetime - Logs after this time -Before datetime - Logs before this time -Keyword string - Search in message text -Top integer 10 Limit results

docs.title: Examples - Level Filters
docs.text:
# All recent logs
./autops.ps1 logs

# More logs
./autops.ps1 logs -Top 50

# Errors only
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Error

# Warnings only
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Warn

# Info only
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Info

# Debug messages
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Debug -Top 100

docs.title: Examples - Time Filters
docs.text:
# Logs after specific time
./autops.ps1 logs -After "2026-01-16 12:00:00"

# Logs before specific time
./autops.ps1 logs -Before "2026-01-16 13:00:00"

# Logs in time range
./autops.ps1 logs -After "2026-01-16 12:00:00" -Before "2026-01-16 13:00:00"

# Today's logs
./autops.ps1 logs -After (Get-Date).Date -Top 100

docs.title: Examples - Keyword Search
docs.text:
# Search for job name
./autops.ps1 logs -Keyword "data_pipeline"

# Search for specific task
./autops.ps1 logs -Keyword "Transform"

# Search for dependency states
./autops.ps1 logs -Keyword "Waiting for"

# Search for errors containing text
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Error -Keyword "connection"

# Search for retries
./autops.ps1 logs -Keyword "Retrying"

docs.title: Examples - Combined Filters
docs.text:
# Errors in last hour
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Error -After ((Get-Date).AddHours(-1))

# Warnings about specific job today
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Warn -Keyword "etl" -After (Get-Date).Date

# Debug logs for troubleshooting
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Debug -After "2026-01-16 13:00:00" -Top 200

docs.title: list
docs.text: List available automations registered in the manifest.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 list [-Type <type>]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# List all (jobs, workflows, tasks)
./autops.ps1 list

# List only jobs
./autops.ps1 list -Type jobs

# List only workflows
./autops.ps1 list -Type workflows

# List only tasks
./autops.ps1 list -Type tasks

docs.title: submit
docs.text: Submit a job for asynchronous execution (returns immediately).

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 submit <job_name> [-Params @{...}]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Submit job for background execution
./autops.ps1 submit data_pipeline

# Submit with parameters
./autops.ps1 submit etl_job -Params @{ source = "api" }

docs.title: service
docs.text: Run AutoPS in service/daemon mode for scheduled job execution.

docs.title: Syntax
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 service

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Start service mode
./autops.ps1 service

# Run in background (Unix)
nohup pwsh ./autops.ps1 service &

# Run as background job (PowerShell)
Start-Job { ./autops.ps1 service }

docs.title: Quick Reference Card
docs.text:
# Initialization
./autops.ps1 init

# Run jobs
./autops.ps1 run <job_name>
./autops.ps1 run <job_name> -Params @{ key = "value" }

# Query executions
./autops.ps1 query                              # Recent 10
./autops.ps1 query -Top 50                      # More results
./autops.ps1 query -Status Failed               # Failed only
./autops.ps1 query -Type job                    # Jobs only
./autops.ps1 query -ExecutionId <guid>          # Full tree

# View logs  
./autops.ps1 logs                               # Recent 10
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Error                  # Errors only
./autops.ps1 logs -Keyword "text"               # Search

# List automations
./autops.ps1 list
./autops.ps1 list -Type jobs

docs.title: Logs Command
docs.text: Query and filter log entries from AutoPS log files.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 logs [options]

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Parameter Values Default Description -Level Info, Warn, Error, Debug, All All Filter by log level -After datetime - Show logs after this time -Before datetime - Show logs before this time -Keyword string - Search for text in log messages -Top integer 10 Limit number of results

docs.title: Recent Logs
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 logs -Top 20

docs.title: Errors Only
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 logs -Level Error

docs.title: Debug Messages
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 logs -Level Debug -Top 50

docs.title: Logs After Time
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 logs -After "2026-01-13 15:00:00"

docs.title: Search by Keyword
docs.text:
./autops.ps1 logs -Keyword "Waiting for"
./autops.ps1 logs -Keyword "data_pipeline"

docs.title: Combined Filters
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 logs -Level Error -After "2026-01-13 14:00:00" -Top 5

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
Logs are displayed with color-coded levels:

  • Info - White
  • Warn - Yellow
  • Error - Red
  • Debug - Gray
[2026-01-13 15:07:43] [Info] Starting Job: hello_world
[2026-01-13 15:07:43] [Error] Task failed: Connection refused
[2026-01-13 15:07:43] [Debug] Task Load is Waiting for: Transform

docs.title: Log File Location
docs.text: Logs are stored in logs/autops_YYYYMMDD.log (one file per day).

docs.title: Query Command
docs.text: Query and monitor job, workflow, and task executions.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 query [options]

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Parameter Values Default Description -Type job, workflow, task, all all Filter by execution type -Status Running, Completed, Failed, Waiting, All All Filter by status -ExecutionId GUID - Query specific execution tree -Name string - Filter by name -StartedAfter datetime - Show executions after this time -StartedBefore datetime - Show executions before this time -Top integer 10 Limit number of results -Sort StartedAt, EndedAt, Status, RuntimeMs StartedAt Sort field -SortOrder Asc, Desc Desc Sort direction

docs.title: Recent Executions
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 query -Top 20

docs.title: Failed Jobs Only
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 query -Type job -Status Failed

docs.title: Running Tasks
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 query -Type task -Status Running

docs.title: Executions After Time
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 query -StartedAfter "2026-01-13 15:00:00"

docs.title: Query Execution Tree
docs.text:
./autops.ps1 query -ExecutionId "abc123-def456-..."

This returns all related jobs, workflows, and tasks sharing the same ExecutionId.

docs.title: Output Fields
docs.text: Field Description ExecutionId Unique execution identifier Type job, workflow, or task Name Automation name Status Running, Completed, Failed, Waiting State Current state (e.g., "Waiting for: TaskA") StartedAt Execution start time RuntimeMs Duration in milliseconds

docs.title: Jobs
docs.text: Jobs are the top-level execution unit in AutoPS. They combine tasks, workflows, and child jobs.

docs.title: Job Structure
docs.text:
{
  "name": "data_pipeline",
  "description": "Full data processing pipeline",
  "cron": "0 * * * *",
  "tasks": [
    { "name": "Start", "task": "notify", "params": { "message": "Starting..." } }
  ],
  "workflows": [
    { "name": "ETL", "workflow": "etl_pipeline" }
  ],
  "jobs": [
    { "name": "Notify", "job": "notify_job" }
  ]
}

docs.title: Job Components
docs.text: Component Description tasks Inline task definitions workflows Referenced workflows jobs Child jobs to execute

docs.title: Execution Order
docs.text:
Steps execute in the order defined, respecting dependencies:

graph TD A[Start Task] --> B[ETL Workflow] B --> C[Notify Job]

docs.title: Scheduling (Cron)
docs.text:
Jobs can be scheduled with cron expressions:

{
  "name": "hourly_sync",
  "cron": "0 * * * *"
}
Expression Meaning 0 * * * * Every hour 0 0 * * * Daily at midnight 0 0 * * 0 Weekly on Sunday */15 * * * * Every 15 minutes

docs.title: Running Jobs
docs.text:
# Run manually
./autops.ps1 run data_pipeline

# With parameters
./autops.ps1 run data_pipeline -Params @{ env = "prod" }

docs.title: Trigger Types
docs.text: Type Description Manual Run via CLI Scheduled Run via cron Invoked by X Called by parent job/workflow

docs.title: Shared Execution ID
docs.text:
All tasks, workflows, and child jobs within a job execution share a single ExecutionId. This allows querying the entire execution tree:

./autops.ps1 query -ExecutionId <guid>

docs.title: Manifest
docs.text: The manifest (automations/manifest.json) is the central registry for all tasks, workflows, jobs, and integrations.

docs.title: Structure
docs.text:
{
  "tasks": { ... },
  "workflows": { ... },
  "jobs": { ... },
  "integrations": { ... }
}

docs.title: Tasks Section
docs.text:
{
  "tasks": {
    "task_name": {
      "file": "tasks/category/script.ps1",
      "description": "What this task does"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Workflows Section
docs.text:
{
  "workflows": {
    "workflow_name": {
      "file": "workflows/category/definition.json",
      "description": "Workflow description"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Jobs Section
docs.text:
{
  "jobs": {
    "job_name": {
      "file": "jobs/category/definition.json",
      "description": "Job description"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Integrations Section
docs.text:
{
  "integrations": {
    "filesystem": {
      "type": "LocalFilesystem",
      "core": true
    },
    "git": {
      "type": "Git",
      "config": {
        "defaultBranch": "main"
      }
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Naming Rules
docs.text:
Names must follow these rules:

  • ✅ Alphanumeric and underscores only: my_task, task123
  • ❌ No hyphens: my-task
  • ❌ No spaces: my task
  • ❌ No special characters: my@task

docs.title: Validation
docs.text:
The manifest is validated on load:

  1. Duplicate key detection - No duplicate JSON keys
  2. Name validation - Names match ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$
  3. Cross-type uniqueness - Names must be unique across tasks, workflows, and jobs
  4. File existence - Referenced files must exist

docs.title: Tasks
docs.text: Tasks are the fundamental building blocks of AutoPS. Each task is a PowerShell script that performs a specific action.

docs.title: Task Structure
docs.text:
A task is a .ps1 file that accepts parameters and optionally returns output.

# automations/tasks/demo/my_task.ps1
param(
    $InputParam1,
    $InputParam2 = "default"
)

# Your logic here
Write-Host "Processing: $InputParam1"

# Return output (optional)
return @{
    result = "success"
    data = $InputParam1
}

docs.title: Registering Tasks
docs.text:
Add tasks to automations/manifest.json:

{
  "tasks": {
    "my_task": {
      "file": "tasks/demo/my_task.ps1",
      "description": "Does something useful"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Task Parameters
docs.text:
Parameters are passed from job/workflow definitions:

{
  "name": "ProcessData",
  "task": "my_task",
  "params": {
    "InputParam1": "value1",
    "InputParam2": "value2"
  }
}

docs.title: Context Passing
docs.text:
Output from one task becomes available to subsequent tasks:

graph LR A[Task A] -->|Output| B[Context] B -->|Input| C[Task B]

Access previous task outputs via the context:

# In Task B, access Task A's output
$previousResult = $Context.TaskA.result

docs.title: Retry Logic
docs.text:
Tasks support automatic retry on failure:

{
  "name": "UnstableTask",
  "task": "fetch_data",
  "retries": 3,
  "retry_delay": 10
}
Parameter Default Description retries 0 Number of retry attempts retry_delay 5 Seconds between retries

docs.title: State Updates
docs.text:
Tasks can update their state during execution:

# Update state (visible in query)
Write-Host "STATE: Processing 50%"
Write-Host "STATE: Finalizing"

docs.title: Workflows
docs.text: Workflows orchestrate multiple tasks with dependencies, allowing complex pipelines.

docs.title: Workflow Structure
docs.text:
A workflow is a JSON file defining tasks and their execution order:

{
  "name": "etl_pipeline",
  "description": "Extract-Transform-Load pipeline",
  "tasks": [
    {
      "name": "Extract",
      "task": "fetch_data"
    },
    {
      "name": "Transform",
      "task": "transform_data",
      "dependsOn": ["Extract"]
    },
    {
      "name": "Load",
      "task": "load_data",
      "dependsOn": ["Transform"]
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Dependencies
docs.text:
Use dependsOn to specify execution order:

graph LR A[Extract] --> B[Transform] B --> C[Load]

Tasks without dependencies run first. Tasks with dependencies wait until all dependencies complete.

docs.title: Parallel Execution
docs.text:
Tasks without interdependencies can run in parallel:

{
  "tasks": [
    { "name": "FetchA", "task": "fetch" },
    { "name": "FetchB", "task": "fetch" },
    { 
      "name": "Merge", 
      "task": "merge",
      "dependsOn": ["FetchA", "FetchB"]
    }
  ]
}
graph LR A[FetchA] --> C[Merge] B[FetchB] --> C

docs.title: Nested Workflows
docs.text:
Workflows can include other workflows:

{
  "name": "full_pipeline",
  "workflows": [
    { "name": "Prepare", "workflow": "preparation" },
    { "name": "Process", "workflow": "etl_pipeline", "dependsOn": ["Prepare"] }
  ]
}

docs.title: Registering Workflows
docs.text:
Add to automations/manifest.json:

{
  "workflows": {
    "etl_pipeline": {
      "file": "workflows/etl/etl_pipeline.json",
      "description": "ETL Pipeline"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Dependency State
docs.text:
When a task is waiting for dependencies, its state shows what it's waiting for:

State: Waiting for: Extract
State: Waiting for: TaskA, TaskB

docs.title: ETL Pipeline Example
docs.text: This example demonstrates a complete Extract-Transform-Load pipeline using AutoPS.

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text: graph LR     A[Start] --> B[Extract]     B --> C[Transform]     C --> D[Load]     D --> E[Notify]

docs.title: Task: fetch_data.ps1
docs.text:
# automations/tasks/etl/fetch_data.ps1
param($Url = "https://api.example.com/data")

Write-Host "Fetching data from: $Url"
Start-Sleep -Seconds 1  # Simulate API call

return @{
    records = @(
        @{ id = 1; name = "Item 1" },
        @{ id = 2; name = "Item 2" }
    )
}

docs.title: Task: transform_data.ps1
docs.text:
# automations/tasks/etl/transform_data.ps1
param($Records)

Write-Host "Transforming $($Records.Count) records..."
Start-Sleep -Seconds 1

$transformed = $Records | ForEach-Object {
    @{
        id = $_.id
        name = $_.name.ToUpper()
        processed = $true
    }
}

return @{ data = $transformed }

docs.title: Task: load_data.ps1
docs.text:
# automations/tasks/etl/load_data.ps1
param($Data)

Write-Host "Loading $($Data.Count) records to database..."
Start-Sleep -Seconds 1

return @{ loaded = $Data.Count }

docs.title: Workflow: etl_pipeline.json
docs.text:
{
  "name": "etl_pipeline",
  "description": "Extract-Transform-Load pipeline",
  "tasks": [
    {
      "name": "Extract",
      "task": "fetch_data"
    },
    {
      "name": "Transform",
      "task": "transform_data",
      "dependsOn": ["Extract"]
    },
    {
      "name": "Load",
      "task": "load_data",
      "dependsOn": ["Transform"]
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Job: data_pipeline.json
docs.text:
{
  "name": "data_pipeline",
  "description": "Full data processing pipeline",
  "cron": "0 * * * *",
  "tasks": [
    {
      "name": "Start",
      "task": "notify",
      "params": { "message": "Pipeline starting..." }
    }
  ],
  "workflows": [
    { "name": "ETL", "workflow": "etl_pipeline" }
  ],
  "jobs": [
    { "name": "Complete", "job": "notify_job" }
  ]
}

docs.title: Running
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 run data_pipeline

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
[Info] Running job: data_pipeline
[Info] Starting Job: data_pipeline (ExecutionId: abc123...)
[Info] Starting Task: Start (using notify)
NOTIFICATION: Pipeline starting...
[Info] Task Start completed in 150ms
[Info] Starting Workflow: etl_pipeline
[Info] Starting Task: Extract (using fetch_data)
Fetching data from: https://api.example.com/data
[Info] Task Extract completed in 1180ms
[Info] Starting Task: Transform (using transform_data)
Transforming 2 records...
[Info] Task Transform completed in 1175ms
[Info] Starting Task: Load (using load_data)
Loading 2 records to database...
[Info] Task Load completed in 1182ms
[Info] Workflow etl_pipeline completed
[Info] Job data_pipeline completed successfully

docs.title: Retry Logic Example
docs.text: This example demonstrates AutoPS retry logic for handling transient failures.

docs.title: Use Case
docs.text: APIs and external services can fail temporarily. Instead of failing the entire pipeline, AutoPS can automatically retry failed tasks.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
{
  "name": "RetryTest",
  "task": "unstable_api",
  "retries": 3,
  "retry_delay": 10
}
Parameter Value Description retries 3 Try up to 3 times after initial failure retry_delay 10 Wait 10 seconds between attempts

docs.title: Example Task
docs.text:
# automations/tasks/tests/retry_test.ps1
$attempt = $env:AUTOPS_ATTEMPT
if (-not $attempt) { $attempt = 1 }

if ($attempt -lt 3) {
    Write-Host "Simulating Failure (Attempt $attempt)..."
    exit 1
}

Write-Host "Success on Attempt $attempt!"
exit 0

docs.title: Job Definition
docs.text:
{
  "name": "retry_job",
  "description": "Test retry logic",
  "tasks": [
    {
      "name": "RetryTest",
      "task": "retry_test",
      "retries": 4,
      "retry_delay": 2
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Running
docs.text: ./autops.ps1 run retry_job

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
[Info] Running job: retry_job
[Info] Starting Task: RetryTest (using retry_test)
Simulating Failure (Attempt 1)...
[Warn] Task attempted 1 failed with ExitCode 1
Task failed. Retrying in 2 seconds (Attempt 2/5)...
Simulating Failure (Attempt 2)...
[Warn] Task attempted 2 failed with ExitCode 1
Task failed. Retrying in 2 seconds (Attempt 3/5)...
Success on Attempt 3!
[Info] Task RetryTest completed in 6500ms
[Info] Job retry_job completed successfully

docs.title: State Tracking
docs.text:
During retries, the task state shows the retry status:

State: Retrying (Attempt 2/5)
State: Retrying (Attempt 3/5)

docs.title: Viewing Retry Logs
docs.text:
./autops.ps1 logs -Keyword "Retrying"
./autops.ps1 logs -Level Warn

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Set appropriate delays - APIs may need time to recover
  2. Limit retries - Don't retry indefinitely (3-5 is typical)
  3. Log failures - Monitor retry patterns to identify systemic issues
  4. Idempotent tasks - Ensure tasks can safely re-run

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• PowerShell 5.1 or higher
  • Windows, macOS, or Linux

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
1. Clone or download the AutoPS directory to your system

  2. Verify installation: 

    cd /path/to/AutoPS
./autops.ps1

  3. Initialize the database: 

    ./autops.ps1 init

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
AutoPS/
├── autops.ps1           # Main entry point
├── config.json          # Configuration
├── core/                # Core modules
│   ├── Database.ps1     # SQL client
│   ├── Engine.ps1       # Execution engine
│   ├── Manifest.ps1     # Manifest loader
│   └── Utils.ps1        # Utilities
├── automations/         # Your automations
│   ├── manifest.json    # Manifest definition
│   ├── tasks/           # Task scripts
│   ├── workflows/       # Workflow definitions
│   └── jobs/            # Job definitions
├── data/                # Database storage
└── logs/                # Log files

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Edit config.json to customize:

{
  "database": {
    "provider": "Json",
    "connectionString": "Data Source=./data/autops.json"
  },
  "logging": {
    "level": "Info",
    "directory": "./logs"
  }
}

docs.title: 1. Create a Task Script
docs.text:
Create automations/tasks/demo/hello.ps1:

param($Name = "World")
Write-Host "Hello, $Name!"

docs.title: 2. Register in Manifest
docs.text:
Add to automations/manifest.json:

{
  "tasks": {
    "hello": {
      "file": "tasks/demo/hello.ps1",
      "description": "Says hello"
    }
  },
  "jobs": {
    "my_first_job": {
      "file": "jobs/demo/my_first_job.json",
      "description": "My first job"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: 3. Create a Job Definition
docs.text:
Create automations/jobs/demo/my_first_job.json:

{
  "name": "my_first_job",
  "description": "My first AutoPS job",
  "tasks": [
    {
      "name": "SayHello",
      "task": "hello",
      "params": {
        "Name": "AutoPS"
      }
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: 4. Run It!
docs.text:
./autops.ps1 run my_first_job

Output: 

[Info] Running job: my_first_job
[Info] Starting Job: my_first_job (ExecutionId: abc123...)
[Info] Starting Task: SayHello (using hello)
Hello, AutoPS!
[Info] Task SayHello completed in 150ms
[Info] Job my_first_job completed successfully

docs.title: What's Next?
docs.text:
• Learn about Tasks
  • Explore Workflows for complex pipelines
  • Use Query to monitor executions

docs.title: Filesystem Integration
docs.text: The filesystem integration provides local file system operations.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
{
  "integrations": {
    "filesystem": {
      "type": "LocalFilesystem",
      "core": true
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Read File
docs.text: $content = Read-AutoPSFile -Path "data/input.txt"

docs.title: Write File
docs.text: Write-AutoPSFile -Path "data/output.txt" -Content $data

docs.title: Check Existence
docs.text:
if (Test-AutoPSPath -Path "data/file.txt") {
    # File exists
}

docs.title: List Directory
docs.text: $files = Get-AutoPSChildItem -Path "data/"

docs.title: Example Task
docs.text:
# tasks/etl/read_input.ps1
param($InputFile)

$content = Get-Content $InputFile -Raw
$data = $content | ConvertFrom-Json

return @{
    records = $data.Count
    data = $data
}

docs.title: Git Integration
docs.text: The Git integration provides repository operations.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
{
  "integrations": {
    "git": {
      "type": "Git",
      "config": {
        "defaultBranch": "main"
      }
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Clone Repository
docs.text: git clone https://github.com/user/repo.git

docs.title: Commit Changes
docs.text:
git add .
git commit -m "Automated update"

docs.title: Push Changes
docs.text: git push origin main

docs.title: Example Task
docs.text:
# tasks/deploy/git_push.ps1
param($Message = "Automated commit")

Set-Location $env:REPO_PATH

git add -A
git commit -m $Message
git push origin main

return @{
    status = "pushed"
    message = $Message
}

docs.title: HTTP Integration
docs.text: The HTTP integration provides REST API capabilities.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
{
  "integrations": {
    "http": {
      "type": "Http",
      "config": {
        "timeout": 30000,
        "defaultHeaders": {
          "User-Agent": "AutoPS/2.1"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

docs.title: GET Request
docs.text: $response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.example.com/data" -Method GET

docs.title: POST Request
docs.text:
$body = @{ key = "value" } | ConvertTo-Json
$response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.example.com/data" -Method POST -Body $body -ContentType "application/json"

docs.title: Example Task
docs.text:
# tasks/etl/fetch_data.ps1
param(
    $Url = "https://api.example.com/data"
)

Write-Host "Fetching data from: $Url"

try {
    $response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $Url -Method GET -TimeoutSec 30

    return @{
        success = $true
        records = $response.data
        count = $response.data.Count
    }
}
catch {
    Write-Error "Failed to fetch: $_"
    throw
}

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
For authenticated APIs, use environment variables or secure storage:

$headers = @{
    "Authorization" = "Bearer $env:API_TOKEN"
}
$response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $Url -Headers $headers

docs.title: Integrations Overview
docs.text: AutoPS supports integrations with external systems and services.

docs.title: Built-in Integrations
docs.text: Integration Type Description filesystem Core Local file system operations git Optional Git repository operations http Optional HTTP/REST API calls

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Integrations are defined in automations/manifest.json:

{
  "integrations": {
    "filesystem": {
      "type": "LocalFilesystem",
      "core": true
    },
    "git": {
      "type": "Git",
      "config": {
        "defaultBranch": "main"
      }
    },
    "http": {
      "type": "Http",
      "config": {
        "timeout": 30000
      }
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Health Checks
docs.text:
Integrations are validated during health checks:

./autops.ps1

Integrations:
[✓] filesystem [CORE]
[✓] git 
[✓] http

docs.title: Using Integrations in Tasks
docs.text:
Access integrations via the $Integrations variable in task scripts:

# Read a file
$content = $Integrations.filesystem.Read("path/to/file.txt")

# Make HTTP request
$response = $Integrations.http.Get("https://api.example.com/data")

# Git operations
$Integrations.git.Commit("Updated config")

docs.title: Custom Integrations
docs.text:
You can add custom integrations by:

  1. Creating an integration module in core/integrations/
  2. Registering it in the manifest
  3. Implementing the required interface methods
